name: Seated March
description: Gentle warmup to raise heart rate while keeping balance demands low.

contraindications.note: Start slowly and pause if symptoms increase.

cues: Lift one knee at a time to a comfortable height.
safetyTips: Stop if hip or knee pain sharpens.

name: Standing March in Place
description: Low-impact marching to build confidence with upright movement.

contraindications.note: Perform near a counter or chair for support.

cues: Stand tall, light fingertip support if needed.
Lift knees softly and swing arms gently.
safetyTips: Use stable support if balance is limited.
Pause if short of breath or dizzy.

name: March with Arm Drive
description: Coordinated march adding arm swing to raise heart rate.

contraindications.note: Keep arm swing below shoulder height if symptomatic.

cues: Stand tall with gentle arm drive.
Land softly and maintain steady breathing.
safetyTips: Shorten stride if balance is challenged.

name: Heel-to-Toe Balance Hold
description: Static balance drill to improve ankle and foot stability.

contraindications.note: Perform with one hand on counter or chair.

cues: Stand tall, one foot directly in front of the other.
safetyTips: Stop if you feel unsteady or dizzy.

name: Wide Stance Balance
description: Low challenge balance stance to build confidence.
cues: Feet wider than hips, knees soft.

name: Chair Sit to Stand
description: Foundational strength move for legs and hips using a chair.

contraindications.note: Use higher chair or assist with hands if painful.

cues: Drive through heels, stand tall, control back down.
safetyTips: Use hands on chair if needed.
Stop if sharp knee pain occurs.

name: Assisted Sit to Stand
description: Supported version using hands or higher seat height.
cues: Place hands on chair or thighs for support.
Keep feet planted and knees aligned.
safetyTips: Use sturdy chair that won't slide.

name: Sit to Stand with Light Load
description: Progressed sit to stand holding light weight for added strength.

contraindications.note: Use bodyweight only if discomfort arises.

cues: Drive through heels and stand tall.

name: Wall Push-Up
description: Upper-body and core strength with minimal joint stress.

contraindications.note: Keep elbows closer to sides and range pain-free.

cues: Step back to create gentle lean.

name: Incline Push-Up
description: Progressed push-up using counter height for added load.

contraindications.note: Keep range shorter and elbows close if symptomatic.

cues: Body in straight line, brace core.
Press through full hand, avoid shrugging.
safetyTips: Use stable surface that will not move.
Stop if wrist or shoulder pain increases.

name: Standing Hip Abduction
description: Hip strengthening with light balance demand.

contraindications.note: Keep one hand on stable surface.

cues: Move leg out to side without leaning.

name: Cat-Cow Mobility
description: Spine mobility flow to reduce stiffness.

contraindications.note: Use fists or elevated hands if wrists are sensitive.

cues: Hands under shoulders, knees under hips.
Alternate rounding and gently arching the spine.
safetyTips: Come up slowly to avoid dizziness.
